item.title: Your Business Website is $7
item.description: Having a business website is essential in today’s digital world. However, the cost of building a website can be a barrier for many businesses. While custom websites can cost thousands of dollars, even basic websites can cost hundreds per year for hosting. But imagine having a professional website and domain for less than $7 annually. This is not a dream. For $6.99 yearly, a major web hosting provider offers domain registration and a five-page website builder.

item.title: 5 Ways to Access An MPLS Network
item.description: MPLS networks have become a sought-after alternative to costly, proprietary WAN networks and the public internet, which can present performance and security challenges. Let’s explore what MPLS networks offer and the various ways to access them. Imagine an MPLS network as a dedicated internet exclusively for businesses. Privately owned and operated, MPLS networks don’t provide services or connections for residential users, making them strictly business-to-business (B2B). Numerous service providers operate their own MPLS networks, offering regional, national, or international coverage.

item.title: Global Payout expands MoneyTrac assistance to the Philippines
item.description: Global Payout, a company that offers business-to-business electronic payment solutions, has expanded its proprietary MoneyTrac consolidated payment gateway (CPG) platform to the Philippines. MoneyTrac allows users to make secure payments to employees and business partners. Users can configure virtual accounts to meet specific payment needs, sending funds to bank accounts in supported countries, debit cards, credit cards, or even other users on the system. Bill Rochfort, President and VP of Sales, highlighted the significant opportunity in providing financial services to the Philippines’ large population, including millions of Filipinos working abroad (OFWs).
